seo_keywords: Dyson V8 soft roller not spinning

problems.title: Motor is Pulsing (Turning On and Off)
problems.description: The vacuum makes a 'breathing' sound or pulses on and off while holding the trigger.
possible_causes: Filter is blocked or needs washing
Blockage in the wand or bin inlet
solution_steps: Check the pre-motor filter (the stick one) and post-motor filter (the back one). Wash them and dry for 24 hours.
Remove the wand and check for clogs inside the tube.
Check the flapper valve inside the dust bin inlet.
If filters are clean and no blockages, the filter might be worn out and needs replacement.

required_parts.name: V8 Filter Replacement Kit (Pre & Post Filters)

problems.title: Battery dies quickly / Not Charging
problems.description: The vacuum runs for only a few minutes or shows a red light when charging.
possible_causes: Battery has reached end of life (common after 2-3 years)
solution_steps: Check the light on the battery. Solid red usually means a battery fault.
If it flashes red, call Dyson.
If it's blue but lasts 2 minutes, the battery cells are degraded and need replacement.

problems.title: Brush Bar Not Spinning
problems.description: The roller head doesn't turn even though the vacuum has suction.
solution_steps: Use a coin to unlock the side cap and pull out the brush bar.
Wipe the electrical contact points on the wand and the head.

faqs.question: Is it worth fixing the issue on a V8 Absolute / Animal Cordless?
faqs.answer: Yes. A replacement part typically costs significantly less than a new $335 vacuum, and extending the life of your Dyson is eco-friendly.

faqs.question: How do I know if my V8 Absolute / Animal Cordless needs a new part?
faqs.answer: Common signs include intermittent power and the device failing to complete a cleaning cycle.

faqs.question: Can I replace the part on my V8 Absolute / Animal Cordless myself?
faqs.answer: Yes, this is a user-serviceable repair. Most replacements generally require just a screwdriver and about 10-20 minutes of time.
